## Database Structure Notes

```text
Database structure
------------------

The textual format does not map directly to the underlying database. In particular it includes some redundant information that is not present in the database:

 * The group annotation, pos, pos-class, defn-note, and usage-note are associated with the group and not the lemma and as such must be the same for each line.

 * SCOWL information is attached to a particular POS within a group and not the word itself. This means that all variants of a word must have the same SCOWL info.
```

## SCOWLv2 Build Process

```shell
make
# This command creates the sqlite3 file 'scowl.db'.

make scowl.txt
# This command optionally creates the flat text file 'scowl.txt'.
```

## SCOWL File Format Specification

```APIDOC
FILE := CLUSTER ...
        [FOOTNOTES]

CLUSTER := GROUP ...
           [CLUSTER-COMMENT] ...

GROUP := LINE ...
         GROUP-COMMENT
         '\n'

LINE := SCOWL_INFO ': '
        ([VARIANT-INFO ' ' ... | OVERRIDE) ': ']
        LEMMA_INFO
        [': ' ENTRY ', ' ...]
        ['#!' WARNING] ...
        ['#' COMMENT] ...
        '\n'

SCOWL_INFO := SIZE [' ' REGION] [' ' CATEGORY] ([' ' TAG] ...)

LEMMA_INFO := LEMMA [' <' POS ['/' POS-CLASS ] '>'] [' {' DEFN-NOTE '}'] [' (' USAGE-NOTE ')']

REGION := 'US' | 'GB' | 'CA' | 'AU'

TAG := '[' TAG-TEXT ']'

LEMMA := [GROUP-ANNOTATION] WORD [ANNOTATION] | '-'

VARIANT-INFO := SPELLING [VARIANT-LEVEL]

SPELLING := 'A' | 'B' | 'Z' | 'C' | 'D' | '_'

VARIANT-LEVEL := '.' | '=' | '?' | 'v' | '~' | 'V' | '-' | '@' | 'x'

OVERRIDE := '+'

GROUP-ANNOTATION := '-' | '@' | '!'

ANNOTATION := '*' | '-' | '@' | '~' | '!' | '†'

ENTRY := DERIVED | '(' [DERIVED-VARIANT-INFO ' ' ... ': '] DERIVED '|' ... ')'

DERIVED := WORD [ANNOTATION] | '-'

DERIVED-VARIANT-INFO := [SPELLING] [VARIANT-LEVEL]

GROUP-COMMENT := '## ' COMMENT-TEXT

CLUSTER-COMMENT :=  '## ' HEADWORD [' (' OTHER-WORDS ')'] ':\n'
```

## Derived Word Forms Specification

```APIDOC
Derived Forms Order:

Noun (n):
  - n0: noun
  - ns: noun: plural
  - nss: noun: plural of plural
  - np: noun: possessive
  - nsp: noun: plural possessive
  - nssp: noun: plural of plural possessive
  Format: n: n0 [ns] [np] | n: n0 ns np nsp

Verb (v):
  - v0: verb
  - vd: verb: past tense (-ed)
  - vd2: verb: past tense plural (were)
  - vn: verb: past participle (-en)
  - vg: verb: present participle (-ing)
  - vs: verb: present tense (-s)
  - vs2: verb: present tense second-person singular (are)
  - vs3: verb: present tense third-person singular (is)
  - vs4: verb: present tense plural (are)
  Format: v: v0 [vd] [vn] [vg] [vs] | v: v0 vd [vd2] [vn] [vg] [vs] [vs2] [vs3] [vs4]

Noun/Verb (n_v):
  - m0: noun/verb
  - ms: noun/verb: (-s)
  Format: n_v: m0 [vd] [vn] [vg] [ms] [np]

Noun/Verb (m - historical):
  - m0: noun/verb
  Format: m: m0 [vd] [vn] [vg] [ms]

Pronoun (pn):
  - pn0: pronoun
  - pn1: pronoun: objective
  - pns: pronoun: plural
  - pnd: pronoun: determiner
  - pnp: pronoun: possessive
  - pnr0: pronoun: reflexive singular
  - pnrs: pronoun: reflexive plural
  Format: pn: p0 [pn1] [pns] [pnd] [pnp] [pnr0] [pnrs]

Determiner (d):
  - d: determiner
  - ds: determiner: plural
  - d1: determiner: form 1
  - d2: determiner: form 2
  Format: d: d [ds] | d: d d1 d2

Adjective (aj*):
  - aj0: adjective
  - aj1: adjective: comparative (-er)
  - aj2: adjective: superlative (-est)
  Format: a*: a*0 [a*1] [a*2]

Adverb (av*):
  - av0: adverb
  - av1: adverb: comparative (-er)
  - av2: adverb: superlative (-est)
  Format: a*: a*0 [a*1] [a*2]

Adjective/Adverb (a - historical):
  - a0: adjective/adverb
  - a1: adjective/adverb: comparative (-er)
  - a2: adjective/adverb: superlative (-est)
  Format: a*: a*0 [a*1] [a*2]

Multi-word ending (we):
  - we: multi-word ending
  - wes: multi-word ending: plural
  - wep: multi-word ending: possessive
  - weps: multi-word ending: plural possessive
  Format: we: we [wes] [wep] | we: we wes wep weps

Conjunction (c), Preposition (pp), Interjection (i), Abbreviation (abbr), Contraction (s), Prefix (pre), Suffix (suf), Multi-word part (wp), Non-word (x).

Note: Entries marked by square brackets are optional and can be excluded without a dash placeholder. Trailing pronoun entries can also be excluded without a dash placeholder.
```

## Correct Missing Derived Forms (.adjust file)

```adjust
A B=: fete <n>: fetes
Av B: fête <n>: fêtes

A B=: fete <v>: feted, feting, fetes
+ Av B: fête <v>: fêted, fêting, fêtes
```

## Wordlist File Structure and Syntax

```APIDOC
File Structure:
  - CLUSTER: Loose grouping of groups.
  - GROUP: Represents one sense of a word, separated by empty lines.

Syntax Elements:
  - Single quotes ('...'): Literal strings.
  - \n: Newline character within literals.
  - []: Optional elements.
  - |: Choice between elements.
  - ...: Optional repetition of preceding element(s).

Special Characters/Annotations:
  - #!: Generated by database export, ignored.
  - #:: Generated by database export, ignored.
  - †: Generated by export code, ignored.
  - -: Placeholder for missing word forms.

File End Information:
  - '#:' lines at the end contain database dumps; these take precedence over documentation in case of disagreement.
```

## Handle Special Case 'thru' (.adjust file)

```adjust
A B: through <aj_av>
AV B-: thru <aj_av>
+ 70: +: thru <aj_av>

A B: through <pp>
AV B-: thru <pp>
+ 70: +: thru <pp>

+ thru <we> # drive-thru
= 50 US: ...
```

## Filter SCOWL Database and Export Results

```shell
./scowl filter --size 70 by-line --db scowl.db --export > scowl-filtered.txt
```

## Filter SCOWL Database and Export Results

```shell
./scowl filter --size 70 by-cluster --export --show-clusters > scowl-filtered.txt
```

## Filter SCOWL Database and Export Results

```shell
./scowl filter by-line --size 60 --spellings A --variant-level 1 --simplify size,tag --export > scowl-filtered.txt
```

## Adjust Variant Info for Derived Entries (.adjust file)

```adjust
strew <v>: -, (strewn | .: strewed), -, -
```
